exercise.instructions: Creating applications, games, and web pages all involve storing and working with different types of data. We are using variables to store the data and be able to access it in future. Every variable has a name and value. Assignment to the variable done by '='. For example: var = 5 The variable 'var' now stores the number 5.

task.content: Set the variable my_number equal to the value 3.
Set the variable my_string equal to the value 'HelloWorld'.

hints.hint: Write the variable name on the left side of operator =, and the value on the right
First option: explicitly set the value to the variable (example: my_number = 3)
Second option: set the value of another variable (example: my_number = var1)
